div1.p: Hench requests extending the loan of a library book for photocopying purposes.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. Christian Bay, January 9, 1941
div1.opener:
Y. F
January 9, 1941
Mr. J. Christian Bay, Librarian
John Crear Library
Chicago, Illinois
My dear Mr. Bay:
div1.p:
I borrowed through our library the
Proceedings of the Third Pan-American Congress
at Havana, referring to the work of the Army
Board on yellow fever. This book was due today
but my returning it to you shall be held up
because I have been trying to get part of it
photostated. I would appreciate your courtesy
in letting me have it a little longer until we
finish this job.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:as
